page.title: 12RAIL TRANS MARTON & N'THORPE
page.content: An important feature of the area is the railway line which passes through. It links Middlesbrough to Whitby, and serves rural and some urban areas between. Two rail halts are in the Nunthorpe and Marton area. Gypsy Lane Halt to the north has been built within the last 10 years to accomodate the increasing commuter demand into Middlesbrough. Some controversy existed two years ago when the manually operated gates, which had protected road traffic on the rail crossing, were removed. The replacing traffic lights and ungated crossing was thought to be dangerous. Nunthorpe itself has a station with a manned signal box. From here the signalman controls this section of track. He also operates the crossing barriers. Trains run about once an hour in each direction and are well used.
